full_text:
Today the Government is introducing big real-terms cuts to pensions and benefit payments.

While it refuses to close the loopholes that let the wealthy dodge their taxes.

Forcing ever more people into poverty is a political choice - one the Tories are always happy to make.

Rishi Sunak's wife says she'll *now* be paying UK tax on her overseas income.

But it's reported she's potentially avoided up to £20 MILLION in UK tax by choosing to be non-domiciled.

So will the Sunak family be backdating all the tax avoided so far? That's what must happen.

British billionaires increased their wealth by £290 MILLION per day in the first year of the Covid crisis alone.

We should impose a Wealth Tax on the super-rich and create a huge Social Emergency Fund to help people through this crisis.

My new article 👇 https://t.co/ZhU0P2kW58

It's reported tonight that Rishi Sunak’s wife potentially avoided up to £20 MILLION in UK tax by choosing to be non-domiciled.

The Chancellor isn't usually shy doing media. He should do a press conference tomorrow to answer questions including how much he's benefited from this.

An Alternative Energy Plan for People & Planet

💰Windfall Tax on oil & gas firm super-profits to lower bills
🏢Bring energy into public ownership
🏡Insulate 19m homes: lowering energy use & bills
☀️Massive increase in onshore wind & solar power
❌Ban new fossil fuel exploration
When I was first elected as an MP in 2015, I was proud to stand on a manifesto to "abolish non-dom status so that all those who make the UK their home pay tax in the same way as the rest of us".

While Rishi Sunak hikes your taxes, his multi-millionaire wife ‘avoids tax through non-dom status'.

https://t.co/UlDKNJJJ1L

As I recently told Politics North, instead of National Insurance hikes there should be a Wealth Tax on the richest 1%. Of course, the Tory MP on the show spoke out against Wealth Taxes! https://t.co/1naddU1wDL

Shell's profits have surged while your energy bills rocket.

Yet it's again paid NO tax on its UK oil & gas profits.

And it gets worse: the Tories gave them a tax rebate of £90 MILLION!

We need a Windfall Tax on Shell's profits - with the money used to lower your energy bills.

Instead of National Insurance hikes for millions of people, we could raise the same amount of money with a 1.5% tax on any wealth over £5 million.

Remember that when the Tories say there is no alternative to today's tax hike!

368 Covid deaths reported today.

Over 20,000 Covid patients in hospital - which is putting significant strain on our NHS.

And it's creating serious staff shortages in other key services.

Living with Covid shouldn't mean the Government pretending it doesn't exist.
Instead of hitting people's living standards, the government should hit the profits of the greedy companies that are ripping people off.

Channel 4 is publicly-owned but receives no public funding.

The reason the Tories want it privatised is purely ideological.

They can't stand things being run for the public good, not private shareholders.

And they want to end the scrutiny they get from Channel 4 News.

Today's UN climate report again underlines just how close we are to climate catastrophe.

We urgently need our Government to maximise the shift to renewable energy and to insulate millions of homes.

Instead it's planning to double down on expensive North Sea oil & gas. Reckless.

Today I met with people from East Leeds and across our city from “Together for Ukrainians”. They are doing amazing work to host, or provide other support to, Ukrainian refugees.

If you want to help their work, the group is meeting this Saturday at the Swarthmore Centre 10am-2pm. https://t.co/AqhRAlvi1h

It doesn't have to be this way. Let's fight for:

➡️ Public ownership of our energy system

➡️ Immediate Windfall Taxes on the profits of oil & gas firms - raising billions to help lower people's bills

It's time that people were put before the super-profits of energy companies.
What an incredible job has been done at the Community Care Hub at @CATCHLeeds, making a huge difference to people in our area in the most difficult of times. https://t.co/wluvuaOdfQ

Great to be out in Halton in the Temple Newsam Ward here in East Leeds, campaigning for the fantastic @debracoupar who is standing for re-election in the local elections on 5th May. 

Debra lives in the Ward, grew up in the Ward and is a real community champion. https://t.co/AdoyBOsxrY

Remember that the boss of one energy giant recently bragged that his firm makes so much profit it's like a “cash machine”. Yet the Tories still won't impose a Windfall Tax on them that could lower your bills by £600. It's clear whose side they're on.

While your bills soar, oil and gas firms are making £900 a second in profit.

But the Chancellor recently told me these firms shouldn't face a Windfall Tax that could be used to lower your bills. The Tories always put the profits of the super-rich first!
https://t.co/AueFAAMAkd
Our energy system - like our NHS - should be publicly-owned and run for the public good, not for private profit.

On #TransDayOfVisibility, solidarity with trans people here in East Leeds, across the country and around the world. 

Let’s build a world of equality, free from discrimination, prejudice and transphobia.
An appalling decision. How on earth is this legal in the 21st Century? https://t.co/BEhj2e5xTk

Wages must be inflation-proofed. Today's decision by the Government to impose below-inflation pay awards on workers who've already had over a decade of pay cuts is outrageous. Workers shouldn't be made to pay for this crisis! I stand fully with you in your fight for pay justice.
Every time you hear a Tory MP saying that there is no alternative to higher bills, remember that energy firms have paid out £200 BILLION to shareholders since 2010.

Care workers do some of the most important work in our society, but many are paid poverty wages. 

Today I joined @LeedsCitizens to call on the Government to provide the funds to ensure care workers are paid at least the real Living Wage that they deserve.  #LivingWage4SocialCare https://t.co/j9DleV8mZT

The Tories are axing free hospital parking for NHS staff from Friday. 

This is a slap in the face for NHS workers who risked their lives for us during the pandemic. Scrap the charges!

This week people's energy bills will rise by 54%.

While gas & oil giants are making £85 MILLION in profits every single day.

A Windfall Tax on these profits could be used to lower people's bills. The Tories have a choice - but they're choosing to put corporate profits first.

Today I joined bereaved families on a march at the National Covid Memorial Wall.

I back @CovidJusticeUK in their call for justice.

I'm also deeply concerned that even more people will lose their lives as the Government abandons free tests and other public health measures. https://t.co/1BeeTj0evh

So people have now been fined for lockdown-busting parties at No 10.

But Boris Johnson told us "the guidelines were followed at all times".

He knew it was a lie. Anyone with an ounce of decency would resign.

Dockers in Holland have refused to load freight onto a ferry in solidarity with the 800 seafarers sacked by P&O.

But our anti-trade union laws would make that solidarity illegal in Britain.

This is the moment to step up the fight to scrap all Britain's anti-trade union laws. https://t.co/t4oGiGAPPz
This is what the Tories think of working-class kids. https://t.co/Fn8FZ0BAeE

In the middle of the deepest attack on living standards in decades, Rishi Sunak has:

▪️Imposed a £500 per year real-terms cut to the benefits of nine million of the poorest people

▪️ Handed bankers a massive tax cut

Now he's claiming his measures are progressive. Ridiculous!

The Tory #PolicingBill - back in Parliament today - is set to ban noisy protests.

I just asked the Minister to confirm that this draconian Bill wouldn't ban protests such as the one I was recently on against P&O for sacking 800 workers.

He refused to give that assurance.

It's time for real action from the Government over P&O.

It should ban P&O from British waters until the sacked workers are reinstated.

It should scrap all contracts with P&O and its parent company.

And it should take over P&O if it still won't comply. https://t.co/CgXe3yIhLM

On Politics North, I called for visas to be scrapped on Ukrainians seeking sanctuary here.

Instead of supporting this position, one adopted by other countries in Europe, the Tory MP started talking about threats of "security risks" and "Russian agents". https://t.co/MtZT8lFvnO

A characteristically brave response from Dawn. Hearing the ‘C’ word at the hospital must have been so frightening. 

We are all so relieved everything’s gone well.

We know resting isn’t your style, Dawn, but before too long you’ll be back to your brilliant business as usual! https://t.co/IFrzPDRWTv

Infuriating to see Tory MPs hinting at financial support for people in the Autumn.  Benefits need raising now. Support to cover energy bills is needed now. Help for families struggling to buy food is needed now. People can't wait six months. The crisis is now. Act now.

Good to be with @Leeds_Labour candidates for the Council Elections in East Leeds.

John (Killingbeck & Seacroft), Pauleen (Crossgates & Whinmoor), Debra (Temple Newsam) and Salma (Gipton & Harehills) all live in the community they are a candidate for and work hard for their area. https://t.co/XcVo1ANZK2

Great turnout for the launch of the @Leeds_Labour Manifesto for May’s Council Elections! 

The Council Elections are a chance to keep Leeds Labour, secure representation from fantastic Labour Councillors in our communities and send a message to this disgraceful Tory  government. https://t.co/v3UofSzrWW

Proud to speak at the launch of the Leeds Labour Manifesto for the Council Elections.

Despite the Tory government’s vicious cuts @Leeds_Labour is making a real difference.

Great to hear from Council Leader @JamesLewisLab, Deputy @debracoupar, @FabianLeedsNE @alexsobel and more. https://t.co/7CResA7yEF
Use this great new site to fight the Tory privatisation of our NHS! https://t.co/B1ik9KkMqx
I believe everyone has the right to a warm home and so our energy system - like our NHS - should be publicly-owned and run for the public good, not for profit.
The P&O case must be a line in the sand. It's time to repeal all the anti-trade union laws. Give workers a proper chance to fight back against terrible bosses.

Here's some of the things that Thatcher privatised.

Imagine how much better we would be able to deal with this cost-of-living crisis if they were still in public ownership.

▪️British Gas
▪️British Petroleum
▪️Water
▪️Electricity
▪️British Rail
▪️British Telecom

We don't need more fake outrage from the Government, we need real  action against P&O.

Until P&O reinstates its workers it should:
▪️lose all Government contracts including for freeports
▪️be barred from British waters
▪️be brought into public ownership

Given the social emergency we face in our country, l'm more convinced than ever that we need a 10% tax on all wealth above £100m. This would raise £69 BILLION. With that, we could create a Social Emergency Fund to ensure everyone is supported through this cost-of-living crisis.

Everyone should watch this video of @AndyMcDonaldMP questioning the P&O Ferries Chief Executive today.

The answers are extraordinary and telling.

They further show the need for government action on P&O now and urgent strengthening of workers’ rights.
https://t.co/oZFLkRtNEZ

The single biggest new source of government income in the Spring Statement doesn't come from taxes on the super-rich but from higher student loan repayments!

It's time not just to scrap university fees but for a serious national conversation about writing-off all student debt.

It used to be the case that we would warn that the poorest people would have to choose between eating a hot meal or heating their home. It's soon going to be the case that huge numbers of people just can't afford to do either.
Profits are soaring. Living standards are plummeting. The reason the Tories did nothing today to address this is because this is the economy they want: one that serves the super-rich.

5 things the Tories refused to do today to protect people's incomes:

❌A Windfall Tax on energy profits to lower bills
❌Increase benefits in line with inflation
❌Boost the Minimum Wage
❌Invest in insulating millions of homes
❌A Wealth Tax to create a poverty reduction fund

Oil & gas companies are making £900 a second in profit. 

But the Chancellor just told me they shouldn't face a Windfall Tax that could lower your bills.

Remember whose side the Tories are on when you open your next energy bill. https://t.co/AueFAAMAkd

Figures show borrowing is £55 billion lower than previously thought. 

Yet Rishi Sunak has only allocated a tiny part of that to helping people facing a cost-of-living crisis.

Instead, he's keeping it for a war chest to deploy in the next election - when he hopes to become PM.

Your energy bills are so high because oil & gas company profits are so high - they're making £900 per second in profits.

Today, we need to see urgent action to lower their profits and use the funds to lower your bills - starting with a Windfall Tax on oil & gas company profits.

Ahead of today's Spring Statement, over 60,000 have now backed my petition calling on the Government to scrap the National Insurance hike and replace it with a Wealth Tax on the richest 1%. 

I have now formally presented the petition to Parliament. https://t.co/2lPSXv8gGw

Today the Government must deliver a social emergency rescue package including:

▪️A Windfall Tax on energy profits to lower bills

▪️Boosts to benefits so they rise with inflation

▪️Axing the National Insurance hike - replace it with a Wealth Tax

▪️Big Minimum Wage increases

I just voted against the Government's plans to strip rights from refugees.

We've recently seen ordinary people doing everything they can to help Ukrainian refugees.

Today Conservative MPs voted to make life harder and more dangerous for those fleeing war, torture & persecution.

Ahead of tomorrow’s mini-budget, I have called on the Government to scrap its plans for big real-terms cuts to benefits & state pensions. In the middle of a cost-of-living crisis it's outrageous that the Tories are slashing the incomes of some of the poorest people even further. https://t.co/G0QekA5Zux

Our NHS is in crisis after a decade of Tory underfunding and privatisation.

Today, I was part of a delegation of NHS workers, campaigners and MPs delivering a petition to Downing St signed by over 175,000 people demanding emergency NHS funding in the Spring Statement. #SOSNHS https://t.co/EuToCtNq5U

Scrap the National Insurance hike on working people - replace it with a Wealth Tax on the super-rich!

My article for the @Independent ahead of Wednesday's mini-budget. 
https://t.co/1Iovuc7bEo

The UK is the fifth-biggest economy on Earth.

But 11 million people face food insecurity.

This must end. 

I joined @IanByrneMP, MPs and #RightToFood campaigners to deliver a letter to Downing St calling for action to end food poverty in the Spring Statement. https://t.co/CxHl0Gsmco

P&O has sacked 800 workers and replaced them with workers earning as little as £1.80 per hour.

We don't need crocodile tears from the Government - we need action.

It should cancel P&O's Government contracts, ban it from British waters and take over P&O if it still won't comply. https://t.co/xLfkXijYAU

Instead of National Insurance hikes for millions of people, we could raise the same amount of money with a 1.5% tax on any wealth over £5 million.

Remember that when the Tories say there is no alternative!

In Parliament, I just voted to: 

◾condemn P&O's firing of 800 staff
◾demand their reinstatement
◾suspend P&O contracts
◾call on the Government to bring a Bill outlawing fire and rehire

The Tories didn't even bother to turn up to vote.

Most benefits and the state pension face big real-term cuts next month.

Today, I called on the Government to act so no-one's benefits fall during this cost-of-living crisis.

The Minister's useless response was to attack me for voting for benefits to increase with inflation. https://t.co/epg1PJId6M
The Government should scrap the proposed National Insurance hike - and replace it with a wealth tax on the richest 1%. https://t.co/7nOtXmujJc

Gas & oil giants are making £900 profit every second.

British billionaires are increasing their wealth by £290 million every day.

Bankers are getting a multi-billion pound tax cut.

We need a Wealth Tax on the richest 1% - not attacks on the living standards of the majority.

So the Government knew in advance that P&O would sack its workers!

Enough of the Tory crocodile tears. We need action.

Until P&O reinstates the workers the government must:

▪️ban P&O from British waters
▪️cancel its state contracts
▪️nationalise P&O if it still doesn't comply

P&O's sacking of its workforce affects every worker.

If they can do this to these workers it'll become the new normal

So we must force the Government to use its powers to get P&O to reverse this: starting by cancelling its government contracts & banning P&O from British waters.

The Government must scrap its National Insurance hike and replace it with a wealth tax on the richest 1%

My article for The @Independent on why the rich should be the ones to pay – not those at the sharp end of a cost-of-living crisis.

https://t.co/1Iovuc7bEo

I just spoke at the @RMTunion protest at P&O's HQ.

Until all the workers get their jobs back, I called for P&O to lose all Government contracts and to be barred from British waters.

If the oligarch owners still don't comply the company should be brought into public ownership. https://t.co/wUPoNRb1yQ

A new report shows that private energy distribution companies have higher profit margins than any other sector.

They've paid out BILLIONS to shareholders in the last few years.

These companies should be publicly owned with those profits instead used to lower people's bills.

In just two days, over 15,000 people have signed the petition I will be presenting in Parliament next week calling for the government to scrap the National Insurance hike and replace it with a Wealth Tax on the top 1%. 

You can add your name here ⬇️: 
https://t.co/djyHWoox9Y

The Government must deny P&O Ferries access to British waters until the sacking of their workforce is justly resolved. 
https://t.co/IdSFs4WnYx

I hope everyone in East Leeds has had a fantastic St. Patrick’s Day.

Irish immigration is a huge part of the East Leeds story.

Always lovely to see people celebrating Ireland, Irish culture, Irish history and the contribution of the Irish community to society around the world.

Great to join @ucl_labour this evening for a discussion on the challenges our society, Party and movement face at this time of multiple crises for the communities we represent and seek to represent. 

Interesting range of questions and an inspiring group of young Labour members! https://t.co/OfjzwoCMr5

In Parliament, I've just offered my solidarity to the sacked P&O ferry workers and condemned the use of balaclava-wearing security guards to force them from their ships.

I called on the Government to deny P&O Ferries access to British waters until this issue is justly resolved. https://t.co/IdSFs4WnYx

P&O Ferries has sacked its entire crew and plans to use agency staff on worse pay.

My full solidarity with the workers and @RMTunion in the fight to defend these jobs.

The Government must immediately intervene to save these jobs and stop workers being thrown on the dole queue.

@BellRibeiroAddy @UKPatchwork @StreathamLabour @LambethLabour @LondonLabour @CommonsSpeaker @HouseofCommons Hugely well deserved recognition of some of the fantastic work you’ve done for your constituents.

Tomorrow my Bill to ban MPs having Second Jobs is back in Parliament. 

This is the final chance for the Tories to give this Bill time to be fully debated.

But if they don't, then I'll be bringing a new Bill in the new Parliamentary session. This issue is not going away.

Last month the Tories voted through a multi-billion pound tax cut for bankers.

At next week's "mini-budget", they should reverse this and instead use the money to lower people's energy bills.

Huge congratulations to my friend and comrade @IanByrneMP for this incredibly well deserved recognition of the work he’s done on the right to food, workers’ rights and access to justice.

As a Liverpool fan he’s used to winning, but this is a victory I can applaud! 👏 https://t.co/jU588vJcD7

Next week is the Spring Statement - the “mini-budget”.

The Tories will try to blame the cost-of-living crisis on the horrific war on Ukraine.

It's not. It's a crisis made in Downing St.

The Tories need to take responsibility and deliver an emergency economic support package.

Fantastic that Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has finally been freed!

Her release comes after years of inspirational work to #FreeNazanin by so many great campaigners but especially her husband Richard.

It was a privilege to meet with Richard during his courageous hunger strike. https://t.co/hirj1XwGre

Boris Johnson is today meeting Saudi leaders whose warplanes have carpet-bombed Yemen in a war that's cost 300,000+ lives.

The UN says Saudi airstrikes - targeting homes, hospitals & schools - are the leading cause of conflict-related civilian deaths.

Don't Yemeni lives matter?

One week today the Chancellor will make his Spring Statement.

To deal with the social emergency people are facing, he should:

◾axe the National Insurance rise
◾boost benefits 
◾put a Windfall Tax on energy profits to lower bills
◾substantially raise the minimum wage

If we put a 10% tax on wealth over £100m, we would raise £69 BILLION. 

That could be used to put an end to the cost of living crisis and ensure nobody is unable to heat their home or is living in hunger

It's not that the Tories can't do this. It's that they choose not to.

8 years today we lost the guiding light that was Tony Benn.

His socialist politics continue to offer ways forward for all progressives who are driven by a desire to build a better world. 

My piece for @tribunemagazine marking this anniversary👇
https://t.co/PLJ9j5zlgG

Great to be in Chester on Saturday with my friend and comrade @MickWhitleyMP for the latest Socialist Campaign Group of Labour MPs Roadshow on socialist policy solutions to the crises people face. 

Always a pleasure to speak alongside Mick and meet fantastic Labour members. https://t.co/HMYqya5XfX

Sign this petition against the visit⬇️
https://t.co/iwuDkVJcft

Boris Johnson's spokesperson says he'll raise Saudi Arabia's execution of 81 people on this week's visit as "we don't shy away from raising these issues with our partners".

Here's a better idea: cancel the visit, stops selling Saudi Arabia arms & stop treating it as a "partner".

BP and Shell are making £85 MILLION in profits every single day. 

That's why your bills are so high. 

That's why we need to target these excess profits with a Windfall Tax and then use the money raised to lower people's energy bills.
Vile human rights abuses at home. Vile human rights abuses in Yemen. And our Government allows billions in arms sales to this appalling regime. https://t.co/1n4oCaJ7ey

Your energy bills are soaring while gas and oil companies make BILLIONS in super-profits.

The answer is simple: lower their profits with a Windfall Tax and use the money raised to lower your bills.

We lost @RMTUnion General Secretary Bob Crow eight years ago today.

Bob was always on the side of the oppressed. The very best way to remember him today is to fight like he did to defend our communities.

Below is my tribute to him at the time of his death. https://t.co/huSqrnq5II

As prices soar, we're heading into a social emergency. So where is the Government's emergency plan? 

There needs to be an immediate boost to benefits, the National Insurance rise axed, a Windfall Tax on energy profits to lower bills, a big boost to the minimum wage & much more.

I'm backing the #StopBenefitDeaths campaign.

We need a public inquiry into serious harm and deaths as a result of the benefits system.

The Government's approach is secretive and not fit for purpose.

⬇️An important new @Rethink_ report into DWP failures https://t.co/RRyedgMzSF

Today's changes to the visa system for those seeking sanctuary from the war in Ukraine are nowhere near good enough.

Ukrainian refugees who don't have family in UK will still not be able to use the new online system.

We should be waiving visas like other countries have done.

The appalling treatment of Ukrainian refugees trying to come to Britain is not down to Government incompetence - it is the product of a decade of the Tories' hostile environment and other toxic policies that have stigmatised those fleeing war, persecution and seeking sanctuary.

Boris Johnson just showed total disregard for the hardship people face due to soaring bills.

Rejected a Windfall Tax on gas & oil firms making BILLIONS in super-profits.

Offered no new financial help.

He's putting the profits of the few ahead of the interests of the many #pmqs

Great piece by @marcusbarnett_  on how hundreds of rail cleaning staff have responded to soaring living costs by getting organised and fighting back for £15 per hour and the right to proper sick pay. https://t.co/I0eoACpEjw
The Government should scrap the National Insurance hike coming in next month and replace it with a Wealth Tax on the richest one per cent.

Happy International Women's Day!

We cannot build a better world without fighting for a world of true justice and equality for women.

#IWD2022 https://t.co/cM0sHq11d7

Gas and oil giants are making £900 profit every SECOND - while millions can't afford to heat their homes.

I believe the right to be warm is more important than these firms' super-profits.
 
We need a Windfall Tax on these super-profits to fund lowering people's energy bills.

The way our Government has dragged its feet and restricted the right of refugees fleeing the war in Ukraine to come here is a disgrace.

It must urgently waive all visa restrictions and provide safe and immediately accessible legal routes to those who want to seek sanctuary here.

Great to be joined last night by Council Leader @JamesLewisLab for a catch up with @leeds_east Project, residents and Councillors on plans for our area and our campaign to get the government to change its mind and back a state of the art sports and wellbeing centre at Fearnville. https://t.co/tu6ehvyxEc

Great to meet up with the brilliant team at our local Citizens Advice Bureau.

People increasingly need their help as the cost of living crisis gets even worse.

They detailed what’s needed to tackle the root causes - for example, a real terms increase not cut to social security. https://t.co/OnQzBvq1Zi

Congratulations @Paulettehamilto on your victory! 

And well done to all the Labour activists who campaigned to ensure this. https://t.co/ve1gjrbUgD

All credit to @TanDhesi for the expert selfie! 

And great to be with @OxfordUniLabour today out in Erdington knocking on doors for @PauletteHamilto

Today is a chance for Erdington to send the Tories a clear message. https://t.co/T1eQkt4MJs

Gavin Williamson has been knighted. 

This is the most corrupt government in our modern history.

British billionaires have been increasing their wealth by £290 million per DAY.

Yet next month the Tories are going to hike National Insurance payments for millions of people. 

Instead of Tory tax hikes on working people, we need a Wealth Tax that hits the super-rich.

The push for a No-Fly Zone by some media commentators is incredibly dangerous and irresponsible. A No-Fly Zone would have to be enforced: NATO countries would have to shoot down Russian planes. That would risk not just a wider war but nuclear war - and the deaths of millions.

Six million families will soon be in fuel poverty.

In the fifth biggest economy in the world no one should go to bed hungry or be unable to heat their home.

We need a Windfall Tax on the oil and gas companies making billions in super-profits that we use to lower people's bills.

Today it was announced that the body that decides MPs’ pay will give MPs a pay rise of £2,200.

This is the wrong decision when millions face a cost-of-living crisis.

As previously promised, I will donate any extra money I get to foodbanks here in East Leeds.

Already in Ukraine we are seeing the appalling human suffering that war always brings. When we urgently need an end to Russia's invasion and a diplomatic solution to this crisis, there is a real danger that this could spiral into a wider war that even risks nuclear war.

I've put down a parliamentary motion to scrap the National Insurance hike - and replace it with a Wealth Tax on the richest 1%. 

46 MPs have now backed it.

The Labour Assembly Against Austerity has launched a tool so you can ask your MP to back it.👇https://t.co/FCz2389swi https://t.co/mmYIVhTDNW

As the UN General Secretary said today, Russia must end its war on Ukraine and there must be a "return to the path of dialogue and diplomacy." That is how we can secure peace, security and human rights.

This morning the @ucu and @unisontheunion strike rally outside Leeds University was an enthusiastic display of solidarity, togetherness and determination to win the fight for fair pay. 

Proud to speak in support of the strikers. They have my 100% backing. https://t.co/MPrds44EKL

Proud to join the @ucu and @unisontheunion picket line at Leeds University this morning to show my support and solidarity.

And great to see backing from students and the wider public for the unions’ fight for fair pay and against low pay, overwork, casualisation and inequality https://t.co/GxG6yIs7Dn

Tonight MPs will again be debating the Government's draconian Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill.

I will voting against the Conservative Government's plans to clamp down on civil liberties and the right to peaceful protest.

This is a very dangerous moment for the world. Russia must end its war and withdraw its troops. We need a diplomatic solution to this dangerous crisis based on peace, security and human rights. https://t.co/PKG2TWbqKK

Wonderful to see volunteers from the Leeds Polish Catholic Centre collecting necessities for refugees from Ukraine.

So many people from our diverse community brought blankets, clothes, toilet rolls, nappies, toothbrushes, wet wipes and more. https://t.co/iD3kQQo2rZ

Solidarity with the people of Ukraine must include support for Ukrainian refugees fleeing Putin's invasion. 

Our Government must waive all visa restrictions on Ukrainians and provide safe and legal routes for Ukrainians fleeing danger to come here.

Solidarity with @zarahsultana who has faced a death threat. 

Dangerous smears and misleading reporting always have consequences, especially in times of war. https://t.co/puYRy6F9Y1

Today I met Leanne Dooley from East Leeds. Her dad Kevin tragically took his life after a DWP decision to stop his benefits, wrongly declaring him fit to work. 

I back Leanne’s campaign for a public inquiry into benefit related deaths and serious self harm.

#NoMoreBenefitDeaths https://t.co/xVpxnon4c8

An important statement from the TUC condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling for Russia to respect Ukrainian territorial integrity and calling for a diplomatic solution to the crisis.
